ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six were reopening a legal issue that they knew had been legitimately settled, saying,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:1.3_0: if he reopens it, saying, “The legal procedure hasn’t been done;” “It’s been done badly;” “It should be done again;”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:1.4_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:1.5_0: “How can the monks from the group of six reopen a legal issue that they know has been legitimately settled?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:1.6_0: “Is it true, monks, that you’re doing this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:1.9_0: “... Foolish men, how can you do this?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:1.10_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:1.11_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:1.12.1_0: ‘If a monk reopens a legal issue that they know has been legitimately settled, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:2.1.4_0: ...The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:2.1.6_0: he knows by himself or others have told him or the donor has told him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:2.1.8_0: done according to the Teaching, according to the Monastic Law, according to the Teacher’s instruction—this is called “legitimately”.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:2.1.10_0: there are four kinds of legal issues: legal issues arising from disputes, legal issues arising from accusations, legal issues arising from offenses, legal issues arising from business.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:2.1.12_0: if he reopens it, saying, “The legal procedure hasn’t been done;” “It’s been done badly;” “It should be done again;” “It’s not been settled;” “It should be settled again,” “It should be settled again,” he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:2.2.1_0: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, and he perceives it as such, and he reopens it, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:2.2.2_0: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but he is unsure of it, and he reopens it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:2.2.3_0: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but he perceives it as illegitimate, and he reopens it, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:2.2.4_0: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but he perceives it as legitimate, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:2.2.5_0: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:2.2.6_0: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, and he perceives it as such, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:2.3.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:2.3.2_0: if he reopens it because he knows that the legal procedure was illegitimate, done by an incomplete assembly, or done against one who did not deserve it;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:2.3.4_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:2.3.5_0: The third rule, the training rule on reopening, is finished.
